name: Air Jordan 11 Retro Gamma Blue (GS)
description: This holiday seasons most anticipated release is almost here, The Air Jordan 11 “Gamma Blue” has been on everyone’s wish list since they were officially announced to release. The Air Jordan 11 has always been a big deal to sneakerheads around Christmas time. Usually Jordan Brand release a retro of the Air Jordan 11 silhouette, but this time we have a never before seen version of the sneaker. The new colorway features a predominantly Black upper with accents of Gamma Blue and Yellow which leads people to believe it might be a “Laney” inspired colorway. A Blue tinted translucent sole finishes off the sneaker look adding to the subtle design.

name: Air Jordan 7 Retro Olympic
description: The Air Jordan 7 (VII) Retro – Olympic white/metallic gold-midnight navy-true red, sometimes called the “Olympics” are probably the most sought after of the Air Jordan 7 (VII).  It features a white upper with silver strips that run through it.  The bottom features red, gold, and blue trim.  These were the sneakers that Michael Jordan wore in the Barcelona Olympic Games.  The Air Jordan 7 is a very unique shoe in the Jordan line as well as a basketball shoe. It featured huarached technology which made the shoe really stick to your foot. Also, the shoe was much lighter than previous Air Jordans as well. The Air Jordan 7 was also unique in that it did not feature the “Nike Air” logo, a visible air unit, or clear soles. Also, it was the first to feature a neoprene liner.

name: Nike CJ81 Trainer w/Megatron Figure
description:
Coming from the just launched Nike “Megatron” pack is this “Megatron” colorway of Calvin Johnson’s signature CJ81 Trainer Max. Like the Nike Air Trainer SC II PRM QS “Megatron,” the CJ81 Trainer Max features a bold, Transformers-inspired design. The purple synthetic upper has been designed to give the shoe an armored, almost robotic appearance and is accented with hits of metallic silver with the classic Transformers grid pattern. Under the midfoot strap is Johnson’s favorite Megatron quote “Show no mercy,” and on the heel is a bold Decepticon logo. In addition to the shoe, Nike has teamed up with Hasbro to a special Transformers Megatron figure inspired by Calvin Johnson — a first for the toy company.

*This item will ship on/around 12/4

name: Air Jordan 5 Retro Laney
description:
This weekend, Jordan Brand will be digging in the retro crates to re-release the “Laney” Air Jordan V. Having originally released back in 2000, you sneakerheads may recall that that time period was home to the Air Jordan V’s OG retro run. In using MJ’s High School as the muse for the color combo, this particular pair of V’s is regarded as one of the most popular non-OG colorways to have hit the sneaker scene. Staying true to its original roots, this upcoming release looks just as good now as it did some 13 years ago. 

Equipped with a crisp tumbled leather upper, the infamous touches of varsity maize and royal lay comfortably about the accents. What better way for Jordan Brand to kick off the month of November then by re-releasing this bonafide classic motif. With over a decade in the books, it’s about time JB dug a little deeper into their sneaker reserves and showed some love to a pair of kicks that haven’t released in a long time. Don’t get me wrong, the most recent retro offerings that have dropped were cool, but it’s definitely time for even more of the classics to make a comeback.

name: Air Jordan 10 Retro Fusion Red (GS)
description:
The Air Jordan 10 has been enjoying quite a bit of publicity this year. Most recently Jordan enjoyed a hugely successful release with the Air Jordan 10 Retro “Steel”, having many stores sell out almost immediately. Beyond that we’ve heard a great amount of buzz for upcoming 2014 Air Jordan 10 colorways. The AJ10 is very busy. And this weekend the 10s give smaller foot sneakerheads a gift with Air Jordan 10 GS “Fusion Red”.

The kicks, who recently got the stamp of approval by Teyana Taylor, feature a very bold fusion red colorway throughout the upper. Black is the only other color present and takes care of the lace area, laces, sole, and logo. These look to be very big amongst GS buyers as largely red sneakers are in high demand.

name: Nike KD 5 Area 72 (GS)
description:
Last year the Galaxy Pack became an international phenomenon when it launched surrounding the festivities in Orlando. There’s no Galaxy Pack this year but we’ve still got three space-inspired releases for Nike’s signature players that are out of this world (pun intended).

What began as a simple idea by members of the Nike Basketball design team has manifested itself into a creative celebration and fictional interpretation for the game’s top players during basketball’s prized weekend. Our heroes appear in a distant universe, where players are not just stars… they come to life as fictional planets on each of the three following shoes.

The Extraterrestrial version of the KD V takes on a lime green, dark green, orange colorway for their descent into Houston. A lime green upper is contrasted by a darker green that takes care of the tongue, Mag heel piece and back of the red speckled midsole before it fades into an even darker green as it approaches the toe. The textured Swoosh design is also dark green. Orange laces, KD branding, and outsole contrast the three shades of green in the best way possible.

name: Air Jordan 5 Retro Bel Air (PS)
description:
How do you successfully create brand new versions of a sneaker that’s 23 years old? As of late Jordan Brand has been more and more dedicated to the story telling aspect of their various retro offerings. In 2013 we had that timely release of the Air Jordan III ’88 Retro on the 25th anniversary of Michael’s legendary Dunk Contest performance in those shoes. Last year the Air Jordan IX “Kilroy Pack” built off the Johnny Kilroy persona to create six separate sneakers revolving around the idea of alternate personalities for Michael Jordan. Earlier on in the same year they served up an Air Jordan IV in an old-school Cleveland Cavs colorway as a nod to “The Shot” that was put up in the face of one Craig Ehlo. Since the Air Jordan line is such a cultural phenomenon, there are plenty more stories to tell beyond those of Michael’s actions and achievements in the shoes, but this upcoming release points to a specific era of influential  fashion and style that even the most modern trends can’t seem to shake.

This brand new Air Jordan 5 release is one that takes a look at the rich history of Jordan Brand in a completely different context. The colorway in place is oriented to the decade that they arrived in and the colorful prints and patterns most closely associated with those times. Keep in mind that the Air Jordan 5 could often be spotted on the feet of many more celebs than just Mike, causing them to also be linked in peoples’ memory with a couple of actors of the day and their associated projects (Which is the origin on the unofficial “Bel Air” nickname in this case). The innards of the shoe feature some West Coast inspired graphics that stick to the florescent end of the spectrum, with the outer planting plenty more of those tones into the accents that pop off the cool grey upper.

name: Air Jordan 3 Retro Bright Crimson
description: The Jordan Retro III “Bright Crimson” is named after the bright crimson color that is featured on the shoe’s midsole and branding. This pair is actually made up mostly of a black tumbled leather upper. Purple is also featured on this release in the crevices of the elephant print on the toe and heel, as well as on the shoe’s outsole under a white midsole.

name: adidas Mutombo
description: After the departure of Patrick Ewing left adidas to scramble for another marketable athlete to carry their basketball line, Dikembe Mutombo’s dominant presence in the paint and unique shot blocking ability presented a rare opportunity for an original sneaker, the likes of which we’ll never see again. After a 20 year hiatus, the original colorway that paid homage to Dikembe’s African heritage with its shield logo dually representing his defensive abilities makes its way back to the forefront with its iconic patterned upper.
